# openapi-java-client

Image-Charts
- API version: 6.1.19
  - Build date: 2024-10-12T10:01:24.341631-04:00[America/New_York]
  - Generator version: 7.9.0

Charts, simple as a URL. A safe and fast replacement for Google Image Charts


*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.8+
2. Maven (3.8.3+)/Gradle (7.2+)

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.openapitools</groupId>
  <artifactId>openapi-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>6.1.19</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
  repositories {
    mavenCentral()     // Needed if the 'openapi-java-client' jar has been published to maven central.
    mavenLocal()       // Needed if the 'openapi-java-client' jar has been published to the local maven repo.
  }

  dependencies {
     implementation "org.openapitools:openapi-java-client:6.1.19"
  }
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/openapi-java-client-6.1.19.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

// Import classes:
import org.openapitools.client.ApiClient;
import org.openapitools.client.ApiException;
import org.openapitools.client.Configuration;
import org.openapitools.client.model.*;
import org.openapitools.client.api.ChartApi;

public class Example {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    ApiClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient();
    defaultClient.setBasePath("https://image-charts.com");

    ChartApi apiInstance = new ChartApi(defaultClient);
    String cht = "bvs"; // String | Chart type
    String chl = "chl_example"; // String | bar, pie slice, doughnut slice and polar slice chart labels
    String chd = "chd_example"; // String | chart data
    String chds = "chds_example"; // String | data format with custom scaling
    String choe = "UTF-8"; // String | QRCode data encoding
    String chld = "L|4"; // String | QRCode error correction level and optional margin
    String chxr = "chxr_example"; // String | Axis data-range
    String chxp = "chxp_example"; // String | axis label positions
    String chof = ".png"; // String | Image output format
    String chs = "chs_example"; // String | Chart size (<width>x<height>)
    String chdl = "chdl_example"; // String | Text for each series, to display in the legend
    String chdls = "000000"; // String | Chart legend text and style
    String chg = "chg_example"; // String | Solid or dotted grid lines
    String chco = "F56991,FF9F80,FFC48C,D1F2A5,EFFAB4"; // String | series colors
    String chtt = "chtt_example"; // String | chart title
    String chts = "chts_example"; // String | chart title colors and font size
    String chxt = "chxt_example"; // String | Display values on your axis lines or change which axes are shown
    String chxl = "chxl_example"; // String | Custom string axis labels on any axis
    String chxs = "chxs_example"; // String | Font size, color for axis labels, both custom labels and default label values
    String chm = "chm_example"; // String | compound charts and line fills
    String chls = "chls_example"; // String | line thickness and solid/dashed style
    String chlps = "chlps_example"; // String | Position and style of labels on data
    String chma = "chma_example"; // String | chart margins
    String chdlp = "r"; // String | Position of the legend and order of the legend entries
    String chf = "bg,s,FFFFFF"; // String | Background Fills
    String chbh = "10"; // String | Bar Width and Spacing. (not supported)  You can optionally specify custom values for bar widths and spacing between bars and groups. You can only specify one set of width values for all bars. If you don't specify chbh, all bars will be 23 pixels wide, which means that the end bars can be clipped if the total bar + space width is wider than the chart width.
    String chbr = "0"; // String | Bar corner radius. Display bars with rounded corner.
    String chan = "chan_example"; // String | gif configuration
    String chli = "chli_example"; // String | doughnut chart inside label
    String icac = "icac_example"; // String | image-charts enterprise `account_id`
    String ichm = "ichm_example"; // String | HMAC-SHA256 signature required to activate paid features
    String icff = "ABeeZee"; // String | Default font family for all text from Google Fonts. Use same syntax as Google Font CSS API
    String icfs = "normal"; // String | Default font style for all text
    String iclocale = "fr"; // String | localization (ISO 639-1)
    Boolean icwt = false; // Boolean | (Private) Force to display the watermark EVEN IF the chart was signed with an enterprise account
    String icretina = "0"; // String | retina mode
    String icqrb = "FFFFFF"; // String | Background color for QR Codes
    String icqrf = "000000"; // String | Foreground color for QR Codes
    try {
      String result = apiInstance.getChart(cht, chl, chd, chds, choe, chld, chxr, chxp, chof, chs, chdl, chdls, chg, chco, chtt, chts, chxt, chxl, chxs, chm, chls, chlps, chma, chdlp, chf, chbh, chbr, chan, chli, icac, ichm, icff, icfs, iclocale, icwt, icretina, icqrb, icqrf);
      System.out.println(result);
    } catch (ApiException e) {
      System.err.println("Exception when calling ChartApi#getChart");
      System.err.println("Status code: " + e.getCode());
      System.err.println("Reason: " + e.getResponseBody());
      System.err.println("Response headers: " + e.getResponseHeaders());
      e.printStackTrace();
    }
  }
}

```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to *https://image-charts.com*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*ChartApi* | [**getChart**](docs/ChartApi.md#getChart) | **GET** /chart | Image-Charts API
*ChartJsApi* | [**getChartjs280**](docs/ChartJsApi.md#getChartjs280) | **GET** /chart.js/2.8.0 | Chart.js as image API

## Documentation for Authorization

Endpoints do not require authorization.


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
